content.label:
This game is pretty fun the campaign took me about 4 hours to beat but after that there isn‚Äôt much to keep the player engaged. Sure there‚Äôs an endless mode but it‚Äôs just the same concept but without an end goal. The game price, I would say, is a little greedy (you are practically paying for a premium version of many free brick breaker games that are already out there) and I think there needs to be more worlds that introduce in game power ups, currently the only in game power up is the purple currency used to buy upgrades. I think there should be more upgrades in the blocks that you break that give you advantages while playing. Although I almost guarantee this game won‚Äôt be updated to add more content I think it desperately needs it to make the game more worthy of its price. I also understand that the developers think that they have a $4 price point standard for each of there games but even though these games look well polished they need more content to justify this ‚Äústandard‚Äù

This whole review was poorly put together and probably sounds like a poorly thought out rant but oh well ü§™

This game is perfect for short spurts, but I find myself wanting to play ‚Äújust one more‚Äù (which turns into 10 more, LOL). 

It‚Äôs optimized for large phones, the file size is small, the graphics are awesome, the controls intuitive. It‚Äôs perfect for when you want something fun and lightly challenging and not mind-bending. You do have to think, but it‚Äôs light strategy with some luck involved. It strikes a great balance. 

No ads. No crazy IAPs. I heartily support developers like this, there aren‚Äôt enough out there. Thanks for a great game! This will be staying on my phone!
Overall: enjoyable. // request: could the coins be used for temporary boosts in the endless mode?
Its a solid game but there is barely any content for having to pay 4 dollars for this game

title.label: Needs more content and a restart option

content.label: Pretty fun little arkanoid clone. There definitely should have been more levels, the game is way too short (gas planet, comet, dwarf star, plenty of potential level names). Also needs a restart level option. Yes I saw the dev response with the gimmicky workaround. If you know people want it and it‚Äôs an easy fix, just add it in properly already.

Jerks who say this is a 99 cent game are the reason the App Store is free of free games that gouge you with in app purchases and dumb subscriptions. 

This is a SOLID game that will give you 4+ hours of entertainment. That is worth the price to me. 

Ball bouncer game, but with unlocks and some minor upgrades through game play. 
Zero ads. Zero upgrades with money. This game s the type of game I try to support.

Physics and GamePlay is a darn blast!

However with only a few levels to play and then an ‚Äòinfinity‚Äô level this should really be a 99 cent game. 

Also the boss is just the same easy ball in every level.  Ugh.

I truly enjoy this game so much that I‚Äôm playing it for the third time. It‚Äôs simple in concept and gameplay, the animation is pleasing, and the experience is a delight. It relaxes me, and serves as both a gaming snack when waiting in line at the bank, and something to enjoy when you have time for a longer play session. 

I sincerely wouldn‚Äôt change a thing.

Yes, the game is kind of addictive, but there isn‚Äôt a restart button, which means that you have to finish the current game your playing, so if by accident you select a planet, star, planetoid or whatever you have to finish the current game or lose on purpose. If you want more balls, more moves or another level, again, you need to finish the current game or lose on purpose. But the worst happens when your current game freezes, kind of. Everything is still working but the ball freeze; so you can change the settings turn off the music, the sound, the language but you cannot restart the game, no matter if you close the game, even if you turn off your device, the game is unplayable. Your only option is to reset the game, which means that you will lose all your progress and achievements, you have to start all over again.
This game is not bad, but is short and definitely not worth 3.99. It reminds me why I should stick to free games.

title.label: Great Game- could use a little more content.

content.label: Found this because of NorthernLion and bought it right away. Pretty fun and addicting. I would love to see more content out of it. (Higher levels, different solar system, perks, idk)
The game is great, but wish they would add more levels.

I‚Äôve played a whole ton of this game. I love it. I do wish there was another level to it though. I‚Äôm at the end and have nothing else to do but aim for high scores. Perhaps a challenge mode?  Anyway, great stuff.

title.label: Great game. Not optimized for current screens.

content.label:
Holedown is a satisfying combination of peggle, pachinko, and strategy.
But it is simply unacceptable to release a fully paid premium game in 2020 that is still not optimized for, now three year old, screen standards.
Having a small usable play area, with a third of my screen completely unused with empty brown borders, is constantly frustrating; Especially given the aspect ratio of this game. 
The bordered areas are not even touch activated to start controls. Causing the game to not only be visually small, but also requiring you to control using the middle of the screen making it unnecessarily difficult and uncomfortable to play.
fun!

With the recent rise of ball bouncers on mobile (thanks in no small part to an absolute onslaught of advertising for these sorts of games), when I read Holedown‚Äôs description of ‚ÄúA ball bouncer but with some depth‚Äù, I was intrigued. And indeed it does have more depth compared to many ball bouncers! It felt less like I was just trying to make the same ideal shots over and over and that I had some strategy in my gameplay choices, but alas; the feeling does not last. Pretty quickly you‚Äôll get to the ‚Äúend‚Äù of the game which is an endless level, and very few upgrades left to purchase. The game should have had so much more than it did, and it‚Äôs a shame that the devs appear to have abandoned this game.
I‚Äôm hopelessly addicted. But I don‚Äôt know where to see a list of best depths on black hole. I‚Äôm currently at 1320 m. Is there a way to compete against other players?

Ya‚Äôll are getting greedy. I beat this is like 3 hours. Now there is no place to go but infinite. Fully upgraded everything. Add more levels or abilities or something for that price.

Also, please keep the time and service indicators visible while using the app. I hate when games take that away and don‚Äôt even use the space for anything.

I didn‚Äôt love it at first, but after a long flight it really grew on me and I was hooked. Has a great balance of strategy and random chance. Figuring out the angles reminded me a lot of playing pool. It‚Äôs a mix of pinball, pool at Tetris.

My only negative is that it (ironically) lacks a bit of depth. You are pretty much doing the same thing the entire game (but with more balls). I would have loved to have seen a few more mechanics introduced as I progressed like combos, power ups, etc.

title.label: Good game please sync between devices

content.label: In this age if iCloud syncing it would be nice to play the same levels on my phone and iPad.  It has been over a year since any updates so if this is not abandonware, please sync progress via iCloud to all my devices.

Really liked this game! Graphics are nice and music/sounds are pleasing. My only complaint is that I was able to finish all the levels too quickly and now only have the black hole level, which isn‚Äôt as fun.
Beautiful design! Perfect balance of fun and challenging. So much attention to detail. PLEASE make more levels!! One of my all time faves.
I really loved this game but upgraded my iPhone twice in the last two years and lost all of my data because you removed iCloud save sync. Idiotic.

title.label: Great game, still has room to grow

content.label: I love the game, it‚Äôs a game I find myself playing ‚Äújust because‚Äù. I just wish as others have said...power ups!! Also I have 9347 crystals hahaha. I need something to spend it on
Fun game, but for 6 levels, this should be free. These games are plentiful and most free games of this ilk are nearly endless, certainly longer than 6 levels.
Fun but light on content
Awesome addictive game. Infinity level is not satisfying though. Please add more planets!!!

title.label: Very enjoyable, but a little short for the price

content.label: Holedown is very fun to play. The controls are simple, the art is simple (yet beautiful), and the sound is pretty good; however, this game took me very little time to complete. The worlds are cool and all, but they all feel the same. This would only be 3 stars if there wasn‚Äôt an endless mode included. GREAT BUT SHORT

I really like this game. However, I‚Äôm at the endgame now, with everything unlocked, and having to sit through it counting every gem I get when there‚Äôs no longer any reason even to keep track is frustrating. When I die I just want to plunge back in.

title.label: Quite fun but the endgame could use a bit more.

content.label:
The journey up to beating the game is addictive fun. Once you reach the end though it peters out.  

An Idea, once you‚Äôve spent all the crystals you can maybe swap them out for temporary power ups. Chain lightning, multiball, drillball, etc.
Loved playing this game and don't regret spending the money but it's already over. I can't believe there's only six levels! Please make more!
Love the game but you‚Äôve left me wanting more. More levels please. I‚Äôd gladly pay for an in-app purchase of a few more levels beyond the black hole endless run.

As many have said, yes, it‚Äôs short. It‚Äôs a very fun game while on the go or if you‚Äôre craving a game that can completed in a few hours. I found it challenging at times, especially once I first started playing but once I maxed out all my upgrades, it was pretty easy. That being said, the game is beautiful, the sound effects are very pleasing, and the music is good. 

I‚Äôd highly recommend this amongst all your others games on iPhone! Hope more levels/gameplay changes are on the way!
A tiny bit more content in the way of upgrades/levels would make this game perfect! It‚Äôs truly the perfect mobile game, really hoping for a follow up!

Fun gameplay. 

There should be a way to bypass or speed up the crystal counting screen at the end of a game, though, and also a way to end a game that‚Äôs obviously going nowhere faster than just waiting to use all your turns.

title.label: Would be worth the price, if there were content updates

content.label: Genuinely fun game mechanic! As it stands, you‚Äôre paying about $1 per hour of content, after which you‚Äôre stuck with one procedurally generated level. If that‚Äôs cool with you, check this out!
I love this game to pieces, and i am disappointed by how short it is. Please make an update with more levels, modes, etc. and you‚Äôll have an amazing game.

title.label: Love it but needs more features added.

content.label:
Needs ability to start at deeper starting depth on Black hole.  Takes forever to challenge high scores over 1,000 depth. 

More planet worlds need to be added to keep continued play interesting and challenging. 

Acquired items also do not sync when going from one machine to another (e.g. iPhone to iPad)

I can‚Äôt stop playing. Amazingly simple concept, done well. Great sounds. Immediate gratification for a well placed shot. 

You can play for 30 seconds, put it down, and come back whenever you like for more.
Solid gameplay, but we get like 4 levels and 1 ‚Äúendless‚Äù mode that is beyond repetitive. Not worth the 4 dollars at all! Should have been 99 cents or free with ads. I fell for it

Y'all spend $12 for a single ticket to crappy 90 minute film but complain when a $4 game only lasts 4 or 5 hours. This game is challenging and crazy fun and it lasts much longer than a $4 burger so I consider that a deal.

title.label: The white finger needs cat ears

content.label: I wish the white finger thingy on the bottom right had the option for kitty ears and says things like ‚ÄúMeew Mreew meow‚Äù when you tap it c^. ,.^n

The game ends too soon with the ‚Äúinfinite‚Äù level, and while I do still play it the game just lost a lot of appeal. I really hope they update the game in some way for more playability, otherwise it‚Äôs pretty disappointing.

All of the mechanics of this game are well made, and I like the idea of having an upgrade system in this genre. However, after you‚Äôve played your first 2-3 minute game you‚Äôve pretty much seen all of the content there is. The upgrades allow you to play longer, and the planets allow you to go deeper, but there is never an inkling of variety or new content, it‚Äôs just more of the same with slightly different colors. It‚Äôs still kind of fun because the mechanics are well done, but not really worth the money.

title.label: I really enjoy this game but

content.label: Don't expect it to last longer than your one play session. After this new update and the last, my progress keeps getting reset on its own.

Update: 1.0.3 version broke in-game music playback. It started playing, then stopped as soon as I selected an arena. Since then I can‚Äôt get the music to play at all. Oddly, sound effects work just fine.

Great mechanic, great music, and so much potential. Different shapes, teleports, hazards, etc., would be fun enhancements down the road.

The most mystifying thing is that you can‚Äôt quit a game and ‚Äúreturn to the surface‚Äù once you‚Äôve started it. The only two buttons are Resume and Options. This odd oversight is worth a star.

Was really enjoying the game and put about two hours into it earning upgrades and new planets. Then I went to play a day later and my progress was reset. It‚Äôs a shame because the game is fun and it‚Äôs really well designed and beautiful.
Played though all the way to the fourth planet and lost all progress next time I loaded app. Game save data lost. I will not be retrying.

title.label: Good but losing progress for no reason is terrible

content.label: Fun until you lose all progress for no reason.  Played for three days then it reset on it‚Äôs own.  If you don‚Äôt mind paying for a game that erases your progress then this game is for you.  It‚Äôs a shame since the free games give you limited turns/lives unless you pay the iron price for more.  Sometimes I feel like we can‚Äôt win

Perfectly polished. Addicting gameplay that helps pass the time. Love that it‚Äôs pay up front (which guarantees that gameplay isn‚Äôt arbitrarily grindy/crippled to make you watch ads or fork over more cash). Paced well and getting 99 balls was challenging. Well worth the price of admission. 

Review written by an indie game dev with love and appreciation for these types of honest games,
Amir - creator of A Dark Room
